article.description: Vlad Moldoveanu scored 23 points, including 13 from the foul line, and American held on to defeat Holy Cross 64-60 Sunday.
article.headline: Holy Cross can't quite catch up with American
article.linkText: Holy Cross can't quite catch up with American
article.story: WASHINGTON -- Vlad Moldoveanu scored 23 points, including 13 from the foul line, and American held on to defeat Holy Cross 64-60 Sunday. Stephen Lumpkins added 13 points and grabbed 11 rebounds for the Eagles (19-8, 9-3 Patriot League), who won their third straight and clinched the second seed with two games to play before the conference tournament. Bucknell's 77-69 victory Sunday at Colgate eliminates the Eagles from contention for the top seed. American led the entire first half and for the early stages of the second, but was challenged repeatedly in the game's final minutes before securing the regular season sweep. After the Crusaders tied it at 56, Troy Brewer hit a shot-clock beating leaner to give American the lead for good with 1:03 left. Mike Cavataio scored 16 points for the Crusaders (6-20, 5-7), who fell to 0-10 in games decided by four points or fewer.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
